item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: We are aware of a Timeout error currently effecting some users of Pavlovia.We are aware of the issue and are currently investigating.We will keep you informed once we have it resolved, apologies for any inconvenience caused.https://discourse.psychopy.org/t/maintenance-work-on-gitlab-server-2023-11-09-2023-11-10/37434/20?u=becca

item.title: Frank Loesche
item.description: I am looking forward to discussing our work on the #Drosophila optic lobe #connectome. Find me at #SfN23 today from 1pm to 5pm (poster 308.01 at board WW77).

item.title: Meredith Schmehl
item.description: Happening now until 5pm at board CC5! Come visit me and learn how your brain uses what you see to help you hear!#SfN23 #SfN2023 #Neuroscience

item.title: Jan Rosenow
item.description: Another scare story in The Telegraph about heat pumps citing research by noise experts. But the experts who did the research say that the article "spins isolated concerns and worst-case scenarios into an exaggerated narrative against heat pumps".https://www.apexacoustics.co.uk/are-heat-pumps-really-too-noisy-for-millions-of-british-homes/

item.title: Eric Mann
item.description: Didn't believe this was a thing until I actually saw it myself.I bank at a small, local credit union. I recently cleared my autocomplete settings so plugged their name into #Google to get back to their homepage.The Sponsored result IS NOT my bank's website. But is skinned the same. 100% a #phishing site served as a Google ad above the legitimate business website.This is a major problem, my friends.

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: @sls See? Short titles are more effective.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: What a house of cards. Much success, little truth.https://www.science.org/content/article/misconduct-concerns-possible-drug-risks-should-stop-stroke-trial-whistleblowers-sayCongratulations to Charles Piller and Science.A few other points of interest below.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Two more sleuths come out: Kevin Patrick and Mu Yang. Congratulations!

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: ‚ÄúUSC takes any allegations relating to research integrity seriously.‚Äù"NIH told Science it takes research integrity concerns very seriously"Let us know if you actually do something?

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Anonymous scientist quoted in the article:"My main residual question is, why? Why would one bother to go to these lengths to change images, when the guy has the resources to generate loads of great papers without doing this?‚ÄùIt's amazing how many people forget that real experiments wouldn't give the desired answers.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description:
"According to Schrag, he, Patrick, and Bik might file a federal whistleblower lawsuit to receive a portion of any NIH funds the government claws back from USC if federal authorities deem Zlokovic‚Äôs work fraudulent."Seems like a good idea:
1) deserved compensation when nobody else will help
2) institutions will only act when it costs them more not to, and funders (cough NIH) could but aren't making that happen.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: It's also worth taking a step back to consider how many young scientists would be corrupted or broken in this sort of lab

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: The clinical trial needs to be stopped. Hopefully legal concerns will force that.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Thread continues here:https://mastodon.social/@BorisBarbour/111405686968265570

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Charan Ranganath will levitate this coming Monday. Don't you dare miss it. #SfN23 #SfN2023Pavlov's Dogz will rock your world. Satisfaction guaranteed! Union Stage, Washington DC Mon Nov 13, 2023. Doors 8pm, show 9pm. Come early for a free drink.
